meanings.sent1: He will lauch the ball to his friend during the game.
meanings.sent2: She lauched the paper airplane across the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician will lauch the cards into the audience for a surprise trick.
meanings.sent4: The wind will lauch the leaves off the tree like tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: The chef will lauch the pizza dough high into the air before baking it.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden movement or start.
meanings.sent1: The cat will lauch itself off the couch to chase a bug.
meanings.sent2: The car lauched forward when the driver pressed the gas pedal.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock will lauch him out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her heart will lauch into a sprint when she hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The rocket will lauch into space with a powerful roar.

meanings.definition: A type of plant related to the onion.
meanings.sent1: She used fresh lauch in her soup for added flavor.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a bunch of lauch from the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried to sneak a bite of the juicy lauch.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with the vibrant green of growing lauch.
meanings.sent5: The chef chopped the fragrant lauch to add to the stir-fry.
